incongruent_moments.reason: The speaker's verbal content, stating, "Just say anything," reflects a dismissive attitude, yet the facial expression indicates a positive engagement with a mean face valence of 0.632, contrasting sharply with the negative audio valence of -0.125, suggesting a disconnection between the spoken words and the non-verbal cues. This divergence highlights a conflict between text and audio modalities. [t: 2.1–16.8 s; text_v: -0.057; face_v: 0.632; audio_v: -0.125]

The speaker's verbal content, stating "I have a million dollars," suggests a confident assertion; however, the negative valence in both facial expressions (-0.0498) and audio tone (-0.1250) indicates a lack of genuine confidence or happiness, revealing a divergence between text and non-verbal modalities. This incongruence suggests potential insincerity or discomfort regarding the claim made. [t: 19.1–28.0 s; text_v: 0.0596; face_v: -0.0498; audio_v: -0.1250].
